definition: flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀圓|银圆/silver dollar
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

sentences.english: He dished out our pay in silver dollars.
sentences.chinese: 他以銀元分發我們的工資。

sentences.english: Huang association army with silver and food do bait aggressively recruiting.
sentences.chinese: 皇協軍以銀元和食物做誘餌大肆招兵。

sentences.english: S. silver certificate, for example, could be redeemed for an actual piece of silver.
sentences.chinese: 例如，一張美國銀元券能兌換一塊銀條。

sentences.english: Wang Lung sat smoking, thinking of the silver as it had lain upon the table.
sentences.chinese: 王龍坐在那裏抽菸，想着剛剛還在桌子上的那塊銀元。

sentences.english: There are eight silver dollars in the drawer.
He put the three silver dollars upon the table .
sentences.chinese: 他把三塊銀元放在桌子上。

sentences.english: In 1904, Huixing has funded three hundred silver dollar.
sentences.chinese: 光緒三十年，惠興募集得到了三百多銀元。

sentences.english: He pulled out a silver dollar and planked it down for a year's subscription.
sentences.chinese: 他掏出一枚銀元，當場付了一年的訂費。

definition: fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀元|银元/silver dollar
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
to cast (pour metal into a mold)
items issued by a postal service and collected by philatelists (stamps, postcards, first day covers etc)
